A very inspiring event today, which put great store on the potential for nature based solutions to address both our climate and biodiversity crisis. https://t.co/eegxORfcUk

Taxi-drivers have had a difficult time during the pandemic. While government has provided ongoing support we realise making an investment in a new vehicle at this time will be a challenge for many. Increased grants will help taxi-drivers make the switch. https://t.co/2EQdVLCsaf https://t.co/C2ZH2mwmG5

Ireland is moving away from fossil fuels towards a renewable future. Today’s decision will ensure legislative effect is given to the commitment in the Programme for Government to end the issuing of new licences for the exploration and extraction of gas. #KeepItInTheGround https://t.co/VRfYS30jKU

Had a good meeting with @dlrcc transport strategic policy committee last week. One of the issues we discussed was the increasing risk of the east pier being damaged from rising sea levels and storms. Hope not too much damage is done today. https://t.co/FCIVc4Xsyz

A big thank you to all the public transport workers and operators who have kept services going right through the difficult last year, maintaining an essential service and keeping everyone safe. @dublinbusnews @IrishRail @Buseireann @cttcireland #StaySafe https://t.co/x3BcFnvdft

Green investment can drive economic recovery and help us reach our climate goals. Emissions fell by around 6% last year – but we need that and more every year. My statement on the @EPAIreland/@SEAI_ie  report on Greenhouse Gas Emissions ➡️https://t.co/MNfC4Xhs0A https://t.co/r5FbKocqL0
Big day for the National Broadband Plan and the State. Connecting communities now more important than ever.  @NatBroadbandIrl @Dept_ECC https://t.co/EQ7oeeh4ef
Utterly unacceptable that such intimidation is being targeted at our Lord Mayor @hazechu #StaySafe https://t.co/ZetghGWoIc

While we’re battling Covid, we’re also working to #BuildBackBetter. Empowering local authorities to deliver high quality walking and cycling networks across the country is good for our health, our environment, and our sense of community. #MakeTheSwitch https://t.co/lkdUZPj6DI

This substantial increase in supports to the @IrishEnvNet couldn't be more timely. They play a crucial role in the fight against climate change. I've worked with the IEN members for many years & will continue to listen, learn, & collaborate with our eNGOs in my role as Minister. https://t.co/gF3yteBCQ3
Cracking poem and performance:  "We will raise this wounded world into a wonderous one." https://t.co/8xDpB9Dh1l
Democracy has prevailed. Congratulations President @JoeBiden and Vice President @KamalaHarris.
A link to my @thisweekrte interview earlier today on the mother and baby homes report, covid 19, transport supply lines and meeting our climate change challenge.  https://t.co/bqq7jgCKmx

I met Michael Byrne last Sunday, the day before he was found dead. A friend had asked me to give him her gloves, a suggestion he shyly but kindly refused. The huge sense of loss at his death locally must be because he was such a special reminder of our common humanity. @ucddublin https://t.co/vOLq8X9s9L

Watch Dr Mike Ryan & Professors Anne Moore, Alister Nichol & Patricis Kearney share their latest analysis of what is happening with the Covid 19 pandemic, at a conversation last week in the @RIAdawson https://t.co/OIKWJ9sP1e
The @HSELive and our vaccine task force is doing a good job getting limited supplies out to our most vulnerable citizens. #StaySafe https://t.co/kTQK3GFJwF
Looking forward to catching up with this programme. Lough Carra is an illustration of what we need to do and how we can do it, with farmers and communities working together. https://t.co/ZX9PwGTjkj
Congratulations Greg, this is really important work. And to all the other student scientists who took part too. https://t.co/Bey6acCcjR

It's been a tough week for everyone, patients, families and frontline workers in particular. The rest of us owe it to them to stick to the restrictions. There will be better days, and news like this gives us hope. https://t.co/5KnaGvVdag

Our wetlands have a key role to play in both storing and capturing carbon emissions. What gets measured gets managed, and this will incentivise us to create more potential for carbon sinks. https://t.co/QeejoagRGQ
Browse the student projects at: https://t.co/Bc549d7uGx @BTYSTE #BeyondLimits

As Minister for Climate, I'm heartened to see projects on climate change, renewables, and biodiversity. Best of luck to all students, and DBS constituents @Saintconleths @SyngeStreetCBS @MuckrossCollege @Sandym0untPark @StMarysPPU @Loreto_Green Sandford Park, Gonzaga College.(2)

Every January, our Young Scientists impress the world with their ingenuity and research. While we cannot celebrate them in person this year, the online portal gives us the opportunity to appreciate the work of thousands of students, teachers, and supporters around the country.(1)

.@ronan_glynn 'The message tonight is to focus on tonight, focus on tomorrow. It's within our power to turn this around but we all need to act as one. Stick to the spirit of the guidance. Stay at home. Work from home. Cut our contacts. Half measures will not be enough.' #StaySafe https://t.co/doAqSszUZq
A murmuration of seabirds on Sandymount Strand this morning. Wishing everyone a peaceful and covid free New Year. #nature #beauty #resilience https://t.co/TCM5TKClB7

The sun rises in spite of everything and the far cities are beautiful and bright. I lie here in a riot of sunlight watching the day break and the clouds flying. Everything is going to be all right.  #ChristmasCard #croaghpatrick #inishbofin #derekmahon #sunrise https://t.co/gvYpN22GSd

Christmas arrived early this year, with the arrival of a giant gingerbread Dail Eireann, made by our neighbours Ailbhe, Honor & Lauren O'Reilly. A real work of art. Happy Christmas everyone. Stay safe. #nollaigshona https://t.co/gFSDj8ufdD
Many thanks @Ryanair for your help in getting Irish people home from GB in the last few days, in coordination with @Dept_Transport and @dfatirl https://t.co/yEauuf3zKo

Thank you @StenaLineUKIE Good to hear the news just now, that you will be doubling your freight services direct from Ireland to the Continent, with effect from tomorrow.  We are working with all our ferry and airline companies to manage the latest covid 19 crisis. https://t.co/DWxHUCVqSv
The scale of ecological change needed in the next thirty years is beyond compare. We can be good at lowering our climate emissions and doing so will be good for all of us.  https://t.co/xCN6f8nKAN

Cross party agreement at north-south ministerial council on possibility of a post pandemic green economic recovery. By restoring our natural world we can trade on a truly origin green brand. Like Beleek china, using our natural resources to create something beautiful that lasts. https://t.co/Ndx3t427Mn

Proud to be part of the European Council which has just agreed the draft European Climate law.  It sets the Union on the path to a 55% reduction in climate emissions by 2030 and climate neutrality by 2050. https://t.co/FmElRgiqjP https://t.co/NVQB1IYSiQ

The most significant single enhancement of services in more than 15 years for Bus Eireann. 120 new jobs in Mayo, Cork, Louth and Limerick. #PublicTransport will be a viable option for more people outside Dublin than ever before. https://t.co/qOtV7f7YP5
@MLiebreich I0

The NTA will assist local authorities in the preparation and design of these facilities. At all times vulnerable users must be prioritised with level crossings, uncluttered footpaths, and places to stop and rest. This is how we #BuildBackBetter. @TFIupdates

Walking and cycling infrastructure is the backbone of the #JustTransition. With this funding, towns and villages throughout the country can once again be safe and attractive spaces for people of all ages and abilities to walk and cycle. https://t.co/v6rusaSoXE https://t.co/TcZ2WGqavF

We are facing a real waste capacity limit, as landfills close & exporting alternatives become less secure. The solution is in our hands, as most material going into black bins can be diverted. We're going to make that easier by regulating industry so all packaging is recyclable. https://t.co/1FJQmTlzPC
'Keep it clean loose & dry' a tip for managing your green recycling bin, from my visit to the Panda waste recycling facility in Ballymount today. #reduce #reuse #recycle https://t.co/gxI4fzQe5M
I was proud to open the @NCBI_sightloss pop up store on Grafton Street today with @conwayforclare https://t.co/VRgJMURfFY

Great day for the #circulareconomy; new purpose for plastics and new life for clothes. Eliminating waste through reuse and recycling. After Panda I called into the very stylish @NCBI_sightloss pop-up on Grafton Street, even picked up a present. #sustainablefashion https://t.co/MTj4HXIONt

As well as our waste fleet going electric, we're going to keep our plastic bottles in this country, and turn them into new bottles, and new jobs. This is the #circulareconomy  in action https://t.co/pZ9VSwLJYL @greenparty_ie https://t.co/1eKTQvOFfy

There is life after diesel. Ireland’s first electric waste collection vehicle will be on the streets in January. It will be powered by solar panels on Panda’s roof. No emissions, no pollution. And quieter too. We're on the road to net zero. #wasteactionplan https://t.co/kZlaPf3OOa

.@EPAIreland "We're also witnessing the erosion of ecosystems & biodiversity on an unprededented scale. We seem unable to stem the tide of nature's destruction & may not understand its full impact until its too late." It's our job in Govt. to help deliver the necessary solutions. https://t.co/6De1tnyCu4
Busy day for the green party, all told. https://t.co/ZajCps2UJb

Tom Donnellan ceo @BordnaMona "This is a historic day for us, as we become a climate solutions company." After Govt. announces €108m of funding for bog restoration projects, covering 33k hectares. It will store carbon, restore biodiversity & secure 350 new jobs. #JustTransition https://t.co/zmhunCCpR3

Myself & Kieran Mulvey meeting with representatives from the 47 projects offered funding under the #JustTransition   Fund. Inspired by the commitment from communities, individuals & businesses to this low carbon journey & by the entrepreneurial & innovative spirit of the region. https://t.co/ozirZ55gvK

With my @greenparty_ie colleague @pippa_hackett at @LoughBooraPark announcing €108m for bog rehabilitation & restoration & €27.8m for #JustTransition Fund projects for the Country, protecting #jobs & #biodiversity & taking real #ClimateAction to help reach our emissions targets https://t.co/zVWR1WjMMH

By funding training & re-skilling, the region can adjust to a low-carbon transition while protecting jobs. Full list of projects: https://t.co/PzlKeDpc0s  The midlands are clearly ready & able to create a new sustainable future.  A good day for #climate, #biodiversity & #jobs

In more midlands good news, provisional offers of funding of €27.8m for 47 #JustTransition projects were also made today. These are innovative & inspiring plans from businesses, councils & communities who are committed to creating a #green & #sustainable economy for the region. https://t.co/kt76TcOqKP

I was delighted to work with @pippa_hackett & @noonan_malcolm to deliver this restoration project which is funded by the Climate Action Fund & will protect the storage of 100m tonnes of carbon & sequester 3.2m tonnes of carbon out to 2050. I'm on @Midlands103 later to discuss.

Announcing today €108m for bog rehabilitation with @BordnaMona to turn carbon sources into sinks, restore biodiversity & help us meet our #climateaction goals. Creating 350 jobs for former power generation workers, it’s a great pilot project for the #justtransition we need. https://t.co/Hh7EpDWC3t
Delighted to support our local authorities and looking forward to this expansion of our Greenway network https://t.co/NdMmSMUcV5

The 3rd round of public consultation on the 16 @BusConnects corridors is open till the 16th of December next. It has the potential to transform Dublin into a more sustainable, social and better working city. View all the plans and share your own views via: https://t.co/3mhlRBHjaW https://t.co/d5PItxB2Ha
A lot of good things happening in Cork City and County. Keep it up! https://t.co/GNaAuhBp3V
Excellent investigative journalism by @Niall_Sargent on what is happening in Irish forestry (via @thejournal_ie) https://t.co/VYmVRx1YB7
Alan Matthews, professor emeritus of Trinity College Dublin, dubbed it a “two fingers” salute to the Green Deal. https://t.co/7Fle84WxWt

Congratulations to our New Zealand Green colleagues @NZGreens on their general election success. “We are stronger at the end of our first term in government than we were at the beginning,” @jamespeshaw https://t.co/7jT1YVFi2z
Greenways bring you to school, help you get to the shops, they are part of tourism but more than anything else, they are local transport projects. https://t.co/imWyIcwY7n

Recognising how critical connectivity is during #Covid19, we'll continue to help people work from home & stay connected safely with €210m to progress the National Broadband Plan & an increase of €5.1m to further develop the National Cyber Security Centre. #Budget2021

We’re allocating €27m to support the roll-out of electric vehicles including grants and charging infrastructure. Changes to VRT will incentivise buyers of low or zero emission cars. #Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

Public transport projects will include funding for public services, progressing Bus Connects,Dart+& Metrolink,rail expansions, tram extensions, helping the public fleet & taxis switch to hybrids & EV’s through scrappage schemes & increased grants.#Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

€360m will go towards over 200 #walking, #cycling projects and €50m for #Greenways around Ireland, helping to support active travel and improving health and well-being nationwide #Budget2021 #GreenRecovery
We are providing €1.8bn for sustainable mobility, cycling, walking and carbon reduction initiatives, changing the way we travel and helping to reach our climate targets #Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

For #Transport we €3.5bn, an increase of 42% or 1bn on 2020 levels and a re-balancing of our investment to provide more viable, sustainable transport options for people & reduce our transport emissions. #Budget2020 #GreenRecovery https://t.co/rZsAVsskUe

I will be dedicating €25.5m to tackle landfill & illegal dumping issues, with €2m for education & awareness programmes around #waste & #circulareconomy as outlined in the #WAP, with the remainder for the remediation of discontinued landfill sites. #Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

€38m in capital funding will go towards energy efficiency & renewable projects & I'm increasing support to the Community Energy Schemes, helping communities to put together their own energy projects & make the transition to a carbon neutral future. ##Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

We plan to retrofit 29,000 homes next year, supporting over 8,000 jobs. I’m also announcing a new One Stop Shop scheme to streamline the retrofitting process and make it easier for householders to access such grants. #Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

Free energy upgrades for lower income households will be funded by €109m of retrofit spend from the carbon tax.This will help more vulnerable people to stay warm,healthy & reduce their bills, ensuring that the carbon tax is socially just & progressive.#Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

I’m delighted to announce €221m funding for residential retrofitting through my own Dept & a total of €286m across Govt to deliver this. This will make homes warmer & more energy efficient while helping to reduce emissions & meet our climate goals.#Budget2021 #GreenRecovery

Setting out below some of the #Budget2021 spend for my own areas of responsibility: Environment, Climate, Transport & Communications in what I believe is a progressive budget that will see us through the crisis, will protect the vulnerable & put us on the road to a #GreenRecovery
https://t.co/TI1fyi2sTb

Proud of our teamwork in #Budget2021 Big increases across the board in arts supports, biodiversity restoration, child protection, climate action, cost rental housing, digital hubs, disability, energy retrofits, Irish language, mental health, organic farming, sustainable transport https://t.co/0Z744q0Aaf

We asked the Department of Finance to analysis the distributional  impact of #Budget2021, including all the tax changes and social welfare increases. It shows that lower income households in the bottom four deciles benefit most. https://t.co/uM6ziXSy5t
"Heed your critics" wise advice I once heard from Hillary Clinton.  https://t.co/twKbHKfseZ
